text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
VisitOccurrence 0..*BaseVisit Occurrence OMOP Table
Instances of this logical model can be the target of a Reference
visit_occurrence_id 1..1integerVisit Occurrence Identifier
person_id 1..1Reference(Person OMOP Table)Person
visit_concept_id 1..1Reference(Concept OMOP Table)Visit
visit_start_date 1..1dateStart Date
visit_start_datetime 0..1dateTimeStart Datetime
visit_end_date 1..1dateEnd Date
visit_end_datetime 0..1dateTimeEnd Datetime
visit_type_concept_id 1..1Reference(Concept OMOP Table)Visit Type
provider_id 0..1Reference(Provider OMOP Table)Provider
care_site_id 0..1Reference(CareSite OMOP Table)Care Site
visit_source_value 0..1stringVisit Source Value
visit_source_concept_id 0..1Reference(Concept OMOP Table)Visit Source Concept
admitted_from_concept_id 0..1Reference(Concept OMOP Table)Admitted From Concept
admitted_from_source_value 0..1stringAdmitted From Source Value
discharged_to_concept_id 0..1Reference(Concept OMOP Table)Discharged To Concept
discharged_to_source_value 0..1stringDischarged To Source Value
preceding_visit_occurrence_id 0..1Reference(Visit Occurrence OMOP Table)Preceding Visit Occurrence

Documentation for this format

name: VisitOccurrence
title: Visit Occurrence OMOP Table
description: This table contains Events where Persons engage with the healthcare system for a duration of time. They are often also called "Encounters". Visits are defined by a configuration of circumstances under which they occur, such as (i) whether the patient comes to a healthcare institution, the other way around, or the interaction is remote, (ii) whether and what kind of trained medical staff is delivering the service during the Visit, and (iii) whether the Visit is transient or for a longer period involving a stay in bed.

element.definition: This table contains Events where Persons engage with the healthcare system for a duration of time. They are often also called "Encounters". Visits are defined by a configuration of circumstances under which they occur, such as (i) whether the patient comes to a healthcare institution, the other way around, or the interaction is remote, (ii) whether and what kind of trained medical staff is delivering the service during the Visit, and (iii) whether the Visit is transient or for a longer period involving a stay in bed.
Use this to identify unique interactions between a person and the health care system. This identifier links across the other CDM event tables to associate events with a visit.
Person
This field contains a concept id representing the kind of visit, like inpatient or outpatient. All concepts in this field should be standard and belong to the Visit domain.
For inpatient visits, the start date is typically the admission date. For outpatient visits the start date and end date will be the same.
Start Datetime

For inpatient visits the end date is typically the discharge date.  If a Person is still an inpatient in the hospital at the time of the data extract and does not have a visit_end_date, then set the visit_end_date to the date of the data pull.
End Datetime
Use this field to understand the provenance of the visit record, or where the record comes from.

There will only be one provider per visit record and the ETL document should clearly state how they were chosen (attending, admitting, etc.). If there are multiple providers associated with a visit in the source, this can be reflected in the event tables (CONDITION_OCCURRENCE, PROCEDURE_OCCURRENCE, etc.) or in the VISIT_DETAIL table.
This field provides information about the Care Site where the Visit took place.
This field houses the verbatim value from the source data representing the kind of visit that took place (inpatient, outpatient, emergency, etc.)
Visit Source Concept

Use this field to determine where the patient was admitted from. This concept is part of the visit domain and can indicate if a patient was admitted to the hospital from a long-term care facility, for example.
Admitted From Source Value
Discharged To Concept
Discharged To Source Value
Use this field to find the visit that occurred for the person prior to the given visit. There could be a few days or a few years in between.
